title: Bicycle History Quiz
description: Pedal through the history of bicycles and test your recall of cycling facts

questions.question: The 'penny-farthing' bicycle is recognized by what distinctive feature?
options: A very large front wheel and small rear wheel

questions.question: The Tour de France, the world's most famous bicycle race, was first held in what year?
What was the 'velocipede,' an early predecessor to the modern bicycle, nicknamed?
The 'safety bicycle,' which closely resembles modern bikes, was introduced in approximately what decade?
Which component allows a cyclist to change gears on a multi-speed bicycle?
John Boyd Dunlop is credited with developing what important bicycle innovation in 1888?
A 'tandem bicycle' is designed for how many riders?
The draisine, considered the first two-wheeled human-powered vehicle, was invented by Karl von Drais in what year?
Which country is often called the 'bicycle capital of the world' due to its cycling culture?
A 'recumbent bicycle' is distinctive because the rider sits in what position?
options: Leaning back in a reclined position

questions.question: The 'Giro d'Italia' is a famous multi-stage bicycle race held in which country?
What type of bicycle has thick, knobby tires designed for off-road trails?
The Wright Brothers, who built the first airplane, originally worked in what related business?
A 'fixie' or fixed-gear bicycle is unique because it lacks what feature?
